Reviews.Title: “My worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Rahher77
Reviews.Content: This was not my first visit to Kensington West hotel, but I came back due to it serve the needs for bed in London (not breakfast). In this visit we came as a group with the big family, 6 adults and 4 children, 3 of them are below 5 years old. Kensington west was not an ideal place, I knew but we were willing to compromise. I have booked the hotel as usual, and made all booking enquiries two months before. All set. And our family started our long trip through UK, England countryside and Scottland all together by cars. There were five other cities that we spent the night before coming to our last stop in London. All hotels booked the same ways, and all were smooth. We arrived in London at 10 PM, and wanted to checked in to our four rooms straight away, as we were all tired. And what happened? Kensington West said there was no booking for us. The four rooms had been canceled and they sent the notification 2 days ago. They said the credit card I gave was declined. Though it worked for other 5 cities. I was like WHAT!! Why don't you notify us at least one week ago whilst our booking had been made 2 months before? Don't they even think that we had travelled and might not get access to our email? And these were kids we were talking about and it was late at night. We were trying to find other hotel that night but all full in London. The kids were afraid and tired and hungry. We were up to the emotion that we almost punch the guy at the reception. Some people were checked out but they said they cannot give us the room as it was booked for others. After two hours arguing, he finally gave one room with three bed for ten of us that night. Never ever I will stay in this hotel with no such consideration like this, with no profesionalism of people that manage the service for people who has travelled from across the world like me.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short holiday or business trip!”
Reviews.Author: FutureGirl88
Reviews.Content: Me and my two friends went down to London and spent one night at Kensington West. It was a pleasant place, the hotel is very clean along with the room. Free tea, coffee and hot chocolate is available, although, you have to walk back to reception where the machine is located to get it. Breakfast can be bought onsite which was a very nice feature, however, we did not purchase it. Our room was a set of bunk beds and one single bed with an en-suite room, which was fine for us as there was a hair dryer, a TV, a good size mirror. Not really any complaints, however, I was only in the hotel for two days. But it's easy to travel there from King's Cross Station as the sub station is incredibly close!

Reviews.Title: “clean well run, very good value.”
Reviews.Author: alan_w190733
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel in december to celibrate my 60th birthday,with my partner. we had a great time,the room was a little small but could not fault anything. i would stay there again and found the staff helpful as for its location its well served by tube and bus and only 25min to the west end.( 5mins to tube station) as for the the people who have wrote negative reports of this hotel they should in my opinion get a life? alan dale skegness

Reviews.Title: “Words aren't sufficient”
Reviews.Author: martwald
Reviews.Content: I normally write reasonably detailed, impartial reviews. With this hotel I can't! I find it bizarre that such a place can sell rooms. We were stuck for a hotel on a business trip and my partner booked this. Where do I start? 1) Behind the check in counter (the bleak check in counter) there was a wooden shelf with a handwritten note stating 'breakfast' selotaped to the front of it. On the shelf there was a ziplock bag with a croissant, some water and who cares what else. 2) The trip to the room reminded me of a bad dream where you are stuck in a building but can't get out. The corridors are all over the place and include numerous fire doors to compensate for the fact that the owners clearly stuffed as many rooms into this property without any regard for customer experience. 3) The room was tiny and the cover to the synthetic duvet was not very nice (I'm trying to be polite here!), suffice to say I slept on top of the duvet, I really didn't fancy getting into the bed. 4) The walls are paper thin. I could hear every conversation, door closing, etc... I couldn't leave here quickly enough.

Reviews.Title: “stress free weekend”
Reviews.Author: sheila alexandr... n
Reviews.Content: when arrived room was small had single bed plus bunk beds ideal for children not an adult , and when was upgraded to a double room had to pay extra 15.00 per night which i thought was disgusting .also stated in discription there would be toiletries in bathroom not there .will not be going there again.On the positive side 5mins from tube station and olympia .bad experience .

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to sleep.....and thats about it....”
Reviews.Author: RallyChick
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I stayed here with a colleague this week purely because it was close to Olympia Conference Centre and the price was ok for a twin room (although we were in the family 5 room). On the positive side: 5 mins walk from Olympia 5 mins walk from the tube Quiet street Excellent pressure in the shower. Clean sheets Now for the negatives: Very cramped (our room had a double bed, bunk beds and a single in - left no room to swing a cat - I would hate to actually have 5 people in this room) Miniscule bathroom (no hand-towels, no bathmat for getting out of the shower, loose fixtures and fittings......but fancy-looking soap and showergel?? Why?? Surely money would be better spent tidying up the rooms?) Terrible mattresses - very lumpy and soggy, awful if you have any kind of back problems like me. Also, rather randomly, the TV remote was fastened to a cable to the wall, presumably so it can't be stolen?? Who would steal a TV remote????!!!! There was also only one socket in our room which was a pain when two of us needed to use computeers/charge phone's etc. Would I stay here again?? Only if I had to be near Olympia; it was for one night only; I was with a colleague (I wouldn't want to be walking the quiet streets on my own to find evening meals etc) and only if there was no-where else. It's very basic, very cramped but is somewhere to put your head for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't!”
Reviews.Author: FifthEarl
Reviews.Content: My in-laws booked to stay here when they arrived from the USA last month. They were met with a room so small there was nowhere to put their luggage, a filthy bathroom, only 1 'crusty' towel, and a surly, rude employee who barely spoke English. Not a great welcome on their first visit to the UK!!

Reviews.Title: “One night in West Kensington makes a hard man humble”
Reviews.Author: 3Frequent_Traveller3
Reviews.Content: The door to the room was broken so every time I went in the man from reception had to open it with a screwdriver. There was no toilet paper in the room so I had to go to reception to ask for some (no phone). The TV in the room did not work and they could not fix it. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen (even smaller than the ones in Hong Kong). The room had bunk beds! Is this a hotel or a hostel? The carpet probably hadn't been cleaned in the 21st Century. And to top it all they refused to give me breakfast saying that I hadn't paid for it even though the booking said it was included.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsPhilipswithoneL
Reviews.Content: The price and location make up for the small room and small bathroom. It is good enough just for sleeping. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The neighborhood wasn't bad either, people were very friendly and everything was a walk or tube ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: gemo0
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is very centrally located. My three adult children and I arrived at 10.30AM and were allowed check in straight away. The staff were friendly and helpfull. We stayed on the third floor in a family room which sleeps five. The room was adiquetly large and clean. The bathroom was spotless and quiet large. The beds were clean and comfortable, one large towel was provided for each of us. We stayed for two nights and the room was made up and fresh towels provided early the next morning. This hotel is very reasonably priced and brilliant if you are looking for a central location, yes the rooms are not huge but as we only wanted a clean and convenient place to stay it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: MiroSK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located close of tube station. Quiet place.Price was OK but I expected better hotel. It was smallest hotel room what I ever senn in EU. On photos looks bigger. Bathroom very small too. Problem make shaver. Hotel relativly clean. Painting of stairway during a normal operation :).

Reviews.Title: “Most overpriced overrated hotel in six weeks travel in Uk and Europe”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: They called it a family room. HA. It was a very small double made even smaller by adding a double bunk. The shower didn't work on our first night. The wardrobe, for the three of us, was the size of a student locker without the door. Without exageration only two of us could stand at the same time. The shower was so small I needed to leave the door open so I could lift my arms to wash my hair or turn around. The toilet area was so small that the toilet roll holder overlapped the toilet seat when I sat. The TV could only be viewed in full if we sat on the end of the bed. My wife couldn't get to her side of the bed if the ladder for the bunk bed was used. The only place to put our three lange suitcases was on the lower bunk because there would not have been any floor space if we'd put them on the floor. No fridge, no hot breakfast available, no dining room, no tea and coffee facilities.... The coffee machinf in the foyer was absolute crap, no fresh milk just stale whitener. To get to our room meant up 1 floor in the lift, push through three heavily sprung fire doors, down two small stair cases, through another small fire door then while holding that fire door open using the electronic door key to access the wardrobe, sorry, room. The windows were not sealed properly so we could hear conversations from all over the place. Yes it was clean, yes it was close to the tube. Yes it was in a nice street, but for 550 pounds for three nights value for money , I don't think so. You live and learn...

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: annemarie1212
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, the hotel is very central, right beside a tube station only a few stops right into the city centre. The rooms are small but the beds are comfortable and it is spotlessly clean, great value for money, i would recommend ths hotel if you need somewhere central and just want a clean place to sleep at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, will be back !”
Reviews.Author: sameer03
Reviews.Content: I loved the service, location and price here. It is not normally a choice for me, as generally I search for 3* and above, but I saw some reviews, and coming from North America, London is very expensive. I did not exactly know the requirements with star ratings, and always that low ratings would mean uncomfortable dirty rooms. I guess maybe because of no bar, or pool. I never need those things on my holiday anyway, as I never use the pool. and in london would rather go out to a bar. The reveiws I saw got me to try this one anyway, and I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a clean, quiet affordable place to stay in london.

Reviews.Title: “good price, clean, a little bit far to the centre”
Reviews.Author: TheTinarelli
Reviews.Content: The Kensington West Hotel was a really cheap and good location to stay. The room was very clean but very small for 4 people. The hotel is located in a really nice neighborhood and not that far away from the underground station "west kensington" - the only thing is, that it needs some time to get to the centre from there. The staff was very helpful, organized a cab to the airport, showd us the shortest ways to places we wanted to go and gave us a lot of tip all around the town. There's no breakfast included but you can buy one for about 4 pounds (breakfast includes 1 muffin, 1 brownie, 1 yoghurt, 1 croissant, 1 orange juice). The is also a coffee despenser for all guest - "serving" coffee, tea and hot chocolate around the clock. we really enjoyed our stay and would definitaly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, shady, dirty and loud - stay away”
Reviews.Author: mm83si
Reviews.Content: I've spent 5 nights in this hotel in March '11 while on a business trip. We decided to book this hotel based on it's location, just 300m from our business venue. We booked two twin rooms, but got doubles instead, since they were all out. As pointed out by other reviewers, the sheets on the beds were stained and dirty. The bed was indented in the middle, so you must image how uncomfortable the sleep was for two business colleagues. The bathroom was cleaned daily, but mold in corners and on the ceiling was a constant reminder of how bad this place was. For the majority of time, there was no hot water. You could only take showers around 3PM, when there was no one at the hotel. The shower drain was clogged and you had to take a shower in 2 minutes, trying not to flood the whole room. It then took approx 10 minutes for the water to drain. On the day of arrival there were two towels on the bed (in a double room), but when cleaning the rooms, they only left one towel every day, so we had to go to the reception and get another towel each morning. The rooms were claustrophobic (together with the bathroom approx 3x3 meters) and we were not even being able to move around the bed, with a third person in the room. The walls are as thin as paper and windows did not close completely so there was constant draft of wind during the nights coming over our heads. During our stay, me any my colleagues in the other room, who were not even on the same floor, were constantly woken up EVERY night by the noise on the halls, next door rooms or upper floors. On the last morning there, we were woken up by a couple getting it on in the room next door. Twice. Good for them, not so much for us, since it was 5 AM. We complained the each morning about the noises at night, but no one seemed to care. Since the noise was from inside the hotel and not the streets, they really should care. The hallways constantly smelled of food (curry) and cigarette smoke. There was a lot of smoking in the hotel amid all the laws and regulations. For the majority of our stay, the elevator was not operational because of the fire alarms constantly going off from all the smoking on the hallways. The bottom line is that this was the worst stay I've ever experienced. There was a lot of other minor issues (four working tv channels, indented bed, no closet) but that is something I can tolerate. The issues above, I cannot. And the worst is, no one seems to care - no acknowledgement of issues, and barely any communication from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling, not a hotel by any means”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say having read the other reviews. We encountered the same problem with a broken window and disgusting bed linen. The hotel are obviously not taking these matters seriously and need to be investigated. The heating was also broken in the hotel so we endured what can only be described as inhumane conditions with no assistance by means of a portable heater or extra blankets offered. The bed linen was stained and small insects visible in the bed. This hotel has no basic standards and some serious internal staff problems. Dont be tempted by the location- this is not a hotel by any means. The management cannot even accept responsibility for the poor and shabby establishment they are running. I would not recommend this hotel and certainly it should not be in operation

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: gcro
Reviews.Content: Let me be clear, if you're not fussy and just need a place to sleep and where to put your belongings this hotel is good enough. I can't recommend the breakfast, we had preordered it and canceled. Its basically yogurt and cereal (3.50). For a bit more, go to Tescos for a breakfast sandwich or go to Hammersmith or Earls Court to get an English breakfast (or anything else). At Hammersmith, you should find Barclays Bar on the right side of Kings Road and they serve a good English breakfast for around 3-5 pounds. The room they gave us was very small, but after 2 nights you get used to it. The ceiling was at a good height and there was plenty of headroom, but the walking space was very limited and only 1 person could walk at a time in the room (room was bunk bed, single bed, table and small open closet). The TV was OK, they had more free TV channels than Holiday Inn, such as VIVA and Dave. I wouldn't take a girl back to the hotel room though, but for a couple of friends its fine. DO bring a thin blanket and a pillow case, their bedding was disgusting. We're talking dry blood, hair and visible dirt (Thank god I didn't get a UV light) and it was pretty hard to adjust to, but after a while you get used to it. That was the only thing that really pissed me off about the hotel. The bathroom was very clean, but it was awfully tiny and it was a wet room. Using the sink meant getting your clothes wet no matter how hard you tried to avoid it, but the shower and the toilet were OK and there were no smells or anything, plus it had good ventilation. Their baggage room is in the lobby, we left our stuff there and we found it when we got back so no complaints there. My friends laptop was kept behind the counter. The price was excellent around 700 between 3 for 7 nights, its a good price for London and if you like your caffeine they offer free coffee, mocha, tea and cappuccino (you can unashamedly take as much as you like). The receptionists were very friendly (I'm not sure about them being professional, but I liked them all). Do not expect them to be plastic suck ups, remember this is a 2 star hotel and not the Hilton. My room mate was rude to them over a period of 2 days and they stopped saying Hi and Bye to him, but I guess this serves him right. Regardless of this they still accommodated his requests. Location 5/5 It is pretty safe, walking around at 11PM wasn't an issue and the only time we saw potential YOBs was at around 1AM walking from Tesco to our hotel on the main road. It was the only scare we had, but they pretty much ignored us. The station it is closest to is West Kensington, and the hotel is a 5 minute walk away straight ahead. West Kensington is within the Zone 1-2 of London (in the center) : 2 stops away from Hammersmith (kings road), 3 from high street kensington, 7-8 from Oxford circus and around 8 stops from Piccadilly circus. Its very close to a sports bar which serves British Ales like Doom Bar, etc called "the 3 Kings". There is a large Tesco shopping center 10 minutes walk from hotel, where you can buy a better breakfast and its also very close to a main road (forgot the name, but as you come to Barclays Bank instead of going straight , cross the road and you'll come across a number of English Pubs and pizza outlets, then you'll reach a main road where there are several places to eat or shop from. Reviewers of the Hotel must remember that this is a 2 star hotel and not a 5 star ,which is why I gave them a review rating of 4 stars and I would have given them 5 if the bathroom was a bit better and the bedding was clean. If I can't afford better, I wouldn't mind going again.

Reviews.Title: “More Bed than Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RobertJNassau
Reviews.Content: Corner property close to Olympia with 40 bedrooms crammed in every corner. CCTV cameras everywhere inside and out so security is good. Efficient reception 24 hrs. No sitting or breakfast space. No breakfast served just nasty looking little packages for sale. Everything clean but an unpleasant rabbit warren of tiny rooms, designed to make money rather than offer hospitality. Last time I will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed in room 26 in this hotel so my...”
Reviews.Author: mricycold
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 26 in this hotel so my comments relate to that room only as I didn't see any other rooms. The most memorable thing about my visit to this hotel was the overwhelming smell which hit me as soon as I entered the stairs area and which carried all the way through to my room. I'm not sure if it was drains or a bad case of damp but it was truly appalling. In my room, there was a large crack in the glass of the window pane and I could not open the window as the frame was jammed stuck. There was no curtain on the window, just a striped blind which offered no privacy whatsoever and let any heat out of the window. I have attached so photos so you can see the points I have referred to. The room cost Â£88 plus an extra charge of Â£3.50 for using Amex to pay. My rate included breakfast but I had to go to reception in the morning to collect this which consisted of a bottle of orange juice, a tub of yoghurt, a plastic wrapped croissant which did not taste fresh and a muffin, again wrapped in plastic. There was a hot drinks machine at reception for free tea and coffee, but there was no milk, just sachets of powdered whitener. There was no kettle or tea making facilities in my room.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: bloodyhandedgod
Reviews.Content: booked a triple room and cot - 1. no room for cot in triple room 2. they did not have a cot for us - booked in september for april - plenty time notice 3. offered us a family room for 4 - double bed and adult bunks 4. ADULT BUNKS - no way were these safe for kids but guess what they expected kids to stay in them but they state catagorically time and time again the are ADULT BUNKS adult means for adults not for kids 5. No working blind in family room and even if it did it was not set into the window recess but on the wall above window and set off centre so light from street lights would still have filtered in - if it had worked. 6. was told only option then was the original triple room - and they would put a cot (which they told us they did not have) or a mattress on the floor - have you seen the size of these rooms!!! - no room for cot or mattress. 7. Bed linen was too small for quilts - they had quilt folded about 10 inches inside top of quilt cover to make them fit!!! 8. got them to see if other superbreak hotels in area had spare room - only had one available in a sister hotel - asked if any premier inns or travel lodges but did not try 9. said they have a taxi company the use - asked for one but clearly he called a friend and not a registered firm - refused to use still trying to get a refund for Hotel and taxi cost to another reputable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: silarem
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good in terms of the Tube (District line), besides that thereâ€™s not much to do in that area since it is residential. The people at the hotel were polite but when we most needed them they were not able to do much. First, we arrived at night our first day to discover that they didnâ€™t gave us our request of four twin beds which was clearly specified in my documents and in their systems, they apologize and recognized their mistake but were not able to gave us the correct room. Second we discover that we didnâ€™t have any electricity in the bathroom, yes no lights, of course no windows etc. The room had a small lamp but the cord was not long enough to reach the bathroom. The front desk lady told us that there was an area under construction in the hotel where maybe we can get a â€œconstruction lampâ€�â€¦we end up going to that part of the hotel which had no lights trying to look for the lamp that she was talking, we finally found it and take it to the room. We connected it and put it in the bathroom but honestly we didnâ€™t felt safe doing this; Iâ€™m sure that this lamp is not supposed to be so close to water and since the bathroom was extremely small there was no way to avoid contact and also the heat generated by the lamp was suffocating and it was only for a short period of time while showering. They told us that the problem was going to be resolved but it never happened, we stayed there for three days and two nights and we didnâ€™t even received a response from the manager (perhaps free breakfast would have been a good gesture for this unfortunate event, but it didnâ€™t happen). I must said that their attitude was good and polite thus not effective and fortunately we obviously didnâ€™t spent much time there so overall the situation at the hotel didnâ€™t ruin our first time in London.

Reviews.Title: “zara was the difference !!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacko57
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights , 27 lads on a stag week-end from killarney Ireland , the accomadation was great but difficult to find after a few pints ?? the location was perfect with a few chelsea fans in the party it made the trip to stamford bridge easy ! And Zara on the frontdesk was fantastic , she made booking in easy , and gave everyone advice on cabs and places of interest , Thanks Zara

Reviews.Title: “Eveline make a pleasure staying at Kensington West Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaPena
Reviews.Content: Eveline, the girl at the front desk made my stay a great one! She was very kind and nice, helping us with whatever we need. She always had a smile in her face and went beyond her duties to make our stay unforgettable Great job Eveline!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lovingculture
Reviews.Content: We stayed at kensington west. You get what you pay for. Our room was clean, the beds were great. The tube was only 5 minutes from hotel. Neighbourhood was not great. But for â‚¬ 200,- per person incl. hotel and flight: what can you expect?! I would reccommend this hotel if you do not have a lot of money to spend but do want to visit london!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: bridies3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends and reading the review of the so called hotel we booked it. Worst decision ever. It is a hostel- in fact I have stayed in much cleaner and better equipped hostels. On arrival we were taken to our "family" room which consisted of a set of bunk beds and a single. I have been in bigger toilet cubicles. We found it very squashed but decided to put up with it until we decided to lie down after a long flight and found body hair on the sheets. We contacted reception and they moved us to a slightly better room albeit the window was broken and we couldn't open it. There were no curtains only a see through blind - on a busy street!! On our third day we requested clean towels as we had been left none and they gave us 2 hand towels for 3 adults. We also had to request more toilet roll as it was not replaced. I have never complained in my life but I could keep writing as the list is endless. I contacted the manager by phone on 3 occasions and sent an e mail but have never been replied to. Be careful of booking fof health and safety issues!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Compact”
Reviews.Author: EMChell
Reviews.Content: It was basic, but clean. I have stayed in many a posh hotel and been both disgusted and offended. Therefore this was acceptable for our short stay. All 4 of us had a really decent sleep. Location wise it was expensive commuting to and from theatre land (I will be writing to Boris re this matter). It is however, easy to get to on the tube. The lady on reception on Saturday evening was really helpful (you don't get that at the Ritz).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Georgia068
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap, clean and well located London hotel for one night and that's what we got. We had no expectations about frills (there are none). I would recommend it if the hotel and its services are not the focus of your time. Like other reviews the key card didn't work initially.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this "Hotel" to anyone”
Reviews.Author: peteCoventry
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room. On arrival found that twin means bunk beds. The so called room was not much wider than a corridor and about as long as a prison cell. Accessing the top bunk would have been lethal so therefore spent a very uncomfortable night sleeping on the floor. No where in their literature of pictures does it mention bunk beds but does show a narrow angle shot of twin beds which I am lead to believe are in a family room. The receptionist was working her first day and been left on her own. I was assured that someone would get back to me re the room, no one did. I have demanded a refund but looking at other comments I don't hold out much hope. Watch this space and please consider very carefully whether you really want to stay here. I have only given a one in the review because the site will not let me give zero.

Reviews.Title: “It's a no-no from me”
Reviews.Author: Plastic_Sprout
Reviews.Content: Thought it was a hotel, but was little more than a hostel, a hostile hostel at that. Luckily it was for just one night as a quick getaway for a west end show otherwise I would have cancelled and moved elsewhere. Room is tiny (I'm a UK size 14 and had trouble turning around in the bathroom), the door was wedged open on arrival, the staff knew about this but made us go to the room to allow us to return to tell them the key did not work, no alternative rooms were available, and it was clear they were not going to help. We had to be allowed into our room by a member of staff...each time. There were no curtains only a see through blind that was broken, on one hand I was glad it was winter so that it was dark at night, but the street could see you with the light on and there was no room to change in the bathroomâ€¦.Nightclub on corner of street is VERY noisy at 3am. Other than that, good value but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Having trouble with your booking, you see we have 2 Jennifer's tonight”
Reviews.Author: BoulderBaehres
Reviews.Content: I've never had a hotel stay that so exactly matched the Trip Advisor reviews! We checked in at 2300 after a show, and they had trouble finding out pre-paid lastminute.com booking. The excuse: "We have 2 Jennifer's staying here tonight, and we don't know which room has been given to the other Jennifer who checked in earlier." The clerk had to go find a room that was unoccupied to give us, and they had us register using the other Jennifer's card. I crossed out every piece of info that didn't match mine, just to be safe, and didn't sign the part saying I'd be liable for charges. When we got to our room, there were no towels, but my partner went back down to the desk, and quickly got some. The key never did work, we just knocked and let each other in. The noise from outside wasn't bad, even after bars closed, but any voice in the hallway seemed to be amplified and played louder right in our room. The fire alarm went off once, and we ignored it. However.......the room was sufficiently clean for me, with no smells or bed bugs. The ensuite was also clean, and not as small as others I've stayed in. The shower was hot with good water pressure. As a place to stay between 2300 and 0900 it fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Reconsider staying here”
Reviews.Author: heyjaghetertomte
Reviews.Content: Rooms the size of prison cells, breakfast containing only Corn Flakes and milk (?!), the smell, keys not working, unsafe location during nighttime, no change of towels or sheets ( we stayed there for three nights and had to share the same two towels the entire time) and not so nice employees. I would really reconsider staying here.. Oh and bye the way. I forgot my brand new glasses there and have repeatedly asked them to send them to me (i live in sweden) but they never answer emails unless its regarding booking.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: SWHotelier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight on a business trip and would not in a million years recommend it. First there were problems booking in as we did not have the paperwork but did have the credit card. Next we were given a key for a family room when we booked two triples. We were then given the family room which by all accounts was ok and a triple which was not. As soon as we walked in the smell of mould hit us and on opening the portaloo, sorry bathroom, door the smell of urine which did not go away when flushing but got worse. We went back to complain and the receptionists could not even get into our room and once he did he sprayed something to cover the smell. We decided to stay in there and put the shower on to warm up, on opening the door the fire alarm went off. The receptionists came to our room and we explained what had happened and he locked our door whilst it was open and said that we could not close it until we went out, so we had to get changed with our door not completely closed. Later that night on returning from having a meal the smell was back. We have since returned home with small insect bites and have contacted the hotel but with no response. This is the worst stay I have ever had - budget should not mean dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a "budget" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret049
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two separate occasions. The first time the bedroom was impossibly small for a double bed but the ensuite bathroom was good. On the second visit the room was a larger one but the ensuite bathroom was miniscule! On both occasions we found the facilities clean and adequate, the beds comfortable and the noise levels reasonably low. There has been an on-going problem with the swipe keys for the door locks which we were told was under review. The hotel is conveniently situated to the West Kensington tube and several convenience stores, as well as a laundrette.

Reviews.Title: “B&B”
Reviews.Author: damienhugh
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a hotel it is a B&B so I will not rate it as a hotel. Booked a double room and was given a room you couldn't swing a mouse in never mind a cat. The smell of raw sewage from the bathroom was stomach turning and if you could stick it long enough to have a shower the fire alarm would go off in the 'so called' bedroom because of the steam. The side of the building has a large sign down the side that says BED & BREAKFAST but they're cute enough not to show that side in photo. The room key never worked so you had to get the reception to keep opening it. WON;T BE BACK!!

Reviews.Title: “Double room booked and paid for - got a cupboard with bunkbeds”
Reviews.Author: SoapFanBath
Reviews.Content: This trip was booked for me and my girlfriend. I was about to go away to Fiji on an expedition for 3 months as a volunteer research assistant - I had to attend a briefing in London. We arrived at hotel to be told there were no doubles available and they took us to the room which was basically a cupboard with bunkbeds. The area was full of house parties and kids hanging around, we did not feel safe. I moved to another hotel. On trying to get our money back I was informed that the Night Desk Operator showed us a double room and we said it was not suitable - THIS IS A TOTAL LIE. I believe they let our room go to someone else I WOULD NEVER EVER RETURN OR RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE. If my elderly grandparents booked this hotel - how could a 74 and 83 year old get into bunkbeds. Disgusting. To date I have not received an apology or refund so in total one nights stay in London - without breakfast cost me over Â£200 as I had to move hotels. BEWARE do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “There are better deals out there”
Reviews.Author: jennnee
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time I have travelled to London, and all four times I stayed in a different hotel. I was very disappointed with this particular hotel. One of the main reasons I chose this hotel was the fact it had WiFI but the Wifi connection was horrendous. I had to purchase a pay-to-go broadband modem in the end from 02. Even after I had raised the matter up to the reception, there was no improvement (to be fair, i guess all she could do then was just to reboot it). We stayed in a room for 5 then a room for 3 when 2 of our party left earlier. The room for five was cramped but that was expected. What was not expected was a window that could not be closed (and the hotel is fairly near a very busy road), a sink so tiny that brushing our teeth was a challenge (plus it clogs) and a bath tub with shower facilities but no shower curtain? I seriously think there is not much point in advertising about their 'branded' shower gel when a simple thing like a shower curtain was not provided for. The room for three was better, esp the shower faciliity. Free hot choc and coffee is nice, but I could have gotten free breakfast and a room for four in Oxford hotel for the same price i was paying for a room for three. Plus the fact that the hotel was in zone two and that added quite a bit more to our travelling expenses. Worse of all was the staff. During my stay, I had come into contact with four different receptionists. Only one was friendly and efficient. All were foreign (and I am not being discriminatory as I am from the same part of the world as them), and do not take the time to listen to their guests even though their command of English was questionable. They initially refused to check my party in as I had made the booking under my name and I arrived later than the rest (even though I was told by the hotel during reservation that it would not be a problem). A few other niggling problems as well but too lengthy to detail here. The impression I got from this hotel was that the owner was not very invested in its management and left it to part-time staffers (mainly students). I would not recomment it to anyone because there are definitely hotels of equal, if not better value, in zone 1, considering their WiFi is really non-existent. Restaurant choices is practically non-existent around the hotel, which again made it inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “new, clean but staff not helpful”
Reviews.Author: yoong_khean
Reviews.Content: We had a room for 5 adults and location wise it is OK about 5-10 minutes walk from the tube station. There is no breakfast included but there is a free coffee machine downstairs but the guests. The rooms are clean and new but our sink was partially clogged and the bath area had no shower curtain which made it a little hard as by the time 5 adults bath, the whole floor was wet. The staff were not very helpful and definitely not friendly. Most of the questions asked they had no idea and we had to borrow their luggage room for half a day which they let but upon arrival to collect them, they left us waiting at the luggage room until we had to go down and ask them again to come up (they already knew we were waiting) The website says free wifi connection, it is true, but the connection is weak and I had alot of trouble getting connected. And when I do, it bumps me off saying there is another user using the IP address. So apart from the cleanliness and location, I dont really feel this was very worth it. Dont bother about the free coffee, it wasnt that great to compel us to stay here again. I'm still sore about the internet...

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dorcysia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in W.K. for a week. My room was very small, but incredibly CLEAN!!!!! it's a good place if you need only a bed to sleep in and then go out in the morning for the whole day :) Staff is really nce and helpful. They called a cab for me in the middle of the night and helped with the luggage. Bathroom is tiny but still, it has a wc, sink and shower - what else is needed? ;)

Reviews.Title: “Location & cleanliness excellent”
Reviews.Author: gabby03
Reviews.Content: Hotel/guest house was near to underground station, clean, recently refurbished. Staff very helpful & friendly. Rooms small but adequate. Hotel is ideal if you are just looking for a clean bed for the night. Area initially intimidating, but incurred no problems walking around with a young child, though very noisy on Saturday night but then it is London. Overall I paid for what I got & was very pleased with the Kensington West.

Reviews.Title: “Great for those on a budget; otherwise, you can do better.”
Reviews.Author: CanuckinScotland
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I found this hotel after scouring the web for a non-sketchy budget hotel in London and booked a double room and a quad room for my family for 6 nights. Though it worked out well for us, if you have high standards and are not willing to be flexible or make compromises, this is not the hotel for you. My impression was that it has been recently refurbished (new paint, new fixtures in the bathroom, overly elaborate motion sensored lights in the hallway), but that it was not being kept up very well - for example, our shower head sprayed water all over the bathroom, and for most of the trip the bathroom smelled of sewage. If you can shrug that sort of thing off, then this hotel is worth the price. The rooms themselves are small and tidy - just enough room for you and your bags. No fridge but there are rather new TVs, and free wireless Internet. Neighbourhood was generally pretty low-key. Only a handful of restaurants nearby, but head one tube stop over to Earl's Court and you'll find a variety of places to eat, including some of the least expensive menus I've seen in London. As a student on a tight budget, I would come back and stay here. The big rooms would be a nice upgrade for backpackers who are sick of hostels, but unless you are trying to save money, splurge a bit for somewhere a little better located and better maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: LolaBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days during a trip across Europe. It took forever to find a suitable place to stay in London as most places are either extremely expensive, or cheap with horrible trip advisor reviews. In this case, the price is right, the location is fine (a 5 minute walk to the West Kensington Tube station which is no big deal), and most importantly the room was clean. I'd absolutely recommend this place for the budget traveller. We had a problem with the TV, and the attendant came to check it out right away. We had fresh towels each day, and the beds were fine (although of course not the most comfortable things in the world)

Reviews.Title: “Not much Fun”
Reviews.Author: Visitor051
Reviews.Content: Walking distaance to Kensington West tube station but the neighborhood made us uncomfortable. Seven doors to access our room, three required the key card. Hot beverage provided in the lobby. Not much variety available for meals nearby so eat before you come or bring your own food. Had to ask for bath towels. No hand towels, washcloths or bath mat provided. Just one sheet and a comforter on the bed which was lumpy. Locked out of our room twice in three days. Reservation was lost. Awakened by fire alarm in middle of the night apparently a false alarm.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: mutreccu
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to London, so finding a hotel was quite a feat. The thing that worried us most was cleanliness (not what London hotels are famous for). After searching through zillions of sites we decided on the West Kensington. I must say that the various reviews were quite accurate. We had a quad which was really microscopic (like the bathroom) however the hotel was SUPER clean, close to the tube station and the area was quaint and pleasant. As the weather was quite cool in the evenings we kept the windows closed so all noises were shut out. Staff was very helpful and friendly, they booked us a cab (at three in the morning), gave us a wake up call and even helped us by re-printing our plane tickets (which we had lost!!!) free of charge. Though I can't really compare it to other hotels as far as prices go (this was our first visit ever) I definitely reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “A rare find for the budget conscious traveler!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanExpatsUK
Reviews.Content: After staying in London budget hotels at least a dozen times, I've come to realize a good value & great hotel when I find one. Most London hotels are small, smelly & just a complete rip-off. But, this hotel is a rare find. 1.) VERY clean. You couldn't have asked for a cleaner hotel. 2.) Great for the budget conscious traveler. It's a perfect find in a very expensive city. 3.) Free coffee/hot chocolate/tea/mocha in the reception area... available all day & night. 4.) Within a 5 minute walk from West Kensington station, with easy/quick access to the sights. 5.) Elevator available for those who need it. 6.) Nice, new refurbished rooms & bathrooms (no shower curtain, but that wasn't a problem.) 7.) We had a room to accommodate 4 people - and was plenty of room. They actually had an extra bed to fit 5! 8.) The front desk / reception workers were very nice & helpful. 9.) Quiet rooms & quiet neighborhood in general. No traffic noise. Book this place... it truly is a rare find for those on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in London town”
Reviews.Author: kiarina1980
Reviews.Content: I've book this hotel because was one of the few hotels with family rooms. The accomodation was confortable for 5 dults, with 4 sigle and a double bed. Small bathroom with a tiny sink, bath tube and wc. For was who want to use the hotel just for sleeping I think that is enough. Cleaning and friendly staff. The hotel has an elevator which I think is essential especially if the room is at the higher floors. I recommend this hotel to couples and groups of young people who want to stay in the center and have a low budget. The hot drinks like coffe, chocolate, tea are free and available 24 hours in the reception, it's possible to have the breakfast pack that inlcludes yogurt, chocolate and other things for just 3.95 gbp. The only inconvenience we had and that I consider serious was no hot water for 2 days (we have passed in the hotel only free nights), The staff was not able to resolve the problem, they apologize and ask to us to patient. At the end we left the hotel and the hot water not yet available. I think that in a city as London it's possible to solve any kind of problem any day of the year even on Saturday and Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “On the Fence - But Cheap”
Reviews.Author: BCollyer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 4 nights. Got a quad which was 54# per night. Was a double bed and two twin beds that were hung from the wall and lowered when needed (like bunk beds). The beds were OK. The room was very clean and I thought it was quiet (my wife would disagree with me as she says there was some noise). Observations (1) Adequate heat if needed but no AC. May be a problem in the summer (2) Area is not real nice but we did not feel unsafe. There was always people walking about. Not one of the nicer areas though as all was old and trash was everywhere (3) bathroom was too small. I am normal size but if you are a plus size person then this hotel is not for you. I would have to think twice about staying here again simply due to the bathroom size. It was smaller then those on cruise ships. It was adequate but very very small. (4) a short walk to the west kinsington tube and thus location is not bad. (5) no breakfest but there is a place on the walk to the tube that sells a nice english breakfest for 4 pounds. (6) Hot Choc. machine (Coffee too) was very good. (7) Wi Fi hotspot is not very good as you can connect about 20% of the time. In summary if you can fit in the bathroom and all you want is a clean place to sleep this is a good cheap hotel. Recommended but would still look at my options for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless”
Reviews.Author: Boiz
Reviews.Content: I would like to say few things about this hotel. My sister stayed at this hotel and I made the reservation for her. I was concerned about a couple of bad reviews I saw on this site. Well the hotel is absolutely an excellent value for a very little money, and the bad things that has been said on this hotel are simply not true. I belive also the bad pictures I saw was created at art. My sister came to visit me and this was the second time she was travelling on her own, so I was concerned about the cleaness and the safety of the accompdation. Here my surprise the room was SPOTLESS, very clean from the catpet to the bed. The toilet was immaculate. I've travelled myself a lot and I've never found something like that with that money. The LOCATION was my second priority for my sister and I have to say was excellent. Very quite neibourhood and first of all SAFE. My sister was alone and she felt perfectelely safe. Very close to the tube station ( district line ) and close to hammersmith road, where the bus number 9 goes to the town. The reception was very kind with me and let me see the room for my sister the day before. One thing the rooms are small but was perfect place to sleep safe clean and quite. Is a bed and breakfast! For the little money my sister paid would be hard to find a place as clean as this. Honestly!!! PS: I would like to suggest to the person who left the bad review about this hotel and was so disappointed to spend a little more money (than 30 Â£ per night) and go straight to Her Majesty the Queen of England and ask if she could rent out a room in Backingam Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: nosduhnivek
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 friends had two rooms in this hotel. Location was great, 10 minutes walk from West Kensington subway. Was quiet at night and the reception staff were friendly. Rooms themselves were small, so were the bathrooms. BUT- the shower worked, so did the toilet, tv and bed (which is quite large). Yeah there was no breakfast, but if you're paying Â£36 a night and want free breakfast then you're probably a cheapskate. The hotel was everything it advertises... I can't understand the negative feedback some people leave. I'd imagine they're probably the same people who complain about the service on RyanAir :P 11/10.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed!”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan5688
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay somewhere in Central London for one night and still hadn't booked it the night before I was heading down south! Was looking on lastminute.com which showed me cheap rooms, and Â£38 didn't seem too bad for such a short-notice deal, especially since I had read reviews for other hotels that were a few pounds cheaper that seemed terrible! I looked directly on the Kensington West hotel site and for some reason, a double room with en-suite cost the same as a single room (Â£38), and reviews were good, so I booked up for the following evening. I arrived at midday and was able to leave my case in a secure luggage room until i checked in later in the evening, when I returned to the hotel. The staff were very helpful and directed me to my room. I was surprised at how clean the room was, it looked very contemporary and had everything I needed for the night. I had no problems with noise at night and the bathroom facilities were clean and above average. The next day, once I had checked out, I was still able to leave my case in the luggage room until I was ready to collect it on my way back to the train station that evening. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by the Kensington West hotel and would definitely recommend it. Next time I'm in London, I will certainly use this hotel, its location was perfect and the value for money was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: stratford100
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel to stay in whilst attending open day at university with my daughter this hotel was just what we needed cheap cheeerful great location access to tube cafes' and a few local shops rooms were clean and staff helpful would defo stay again

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: DinoAraujo
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews from this hotel I was expecting a lot more! The room was overprized and I just feel their hands slipped into my pocket. Not even free breakfast for the price! Negatives: The toilet's so small you can't do anything there, you can't even wash your face in the sink. But hey, at least it has one! The tap wasn't working so I only had (very) hot water and there was no towel hanger. You can hear everything on the top floor of the room. There are no blinds in room's window so it is so bright at night as by day and everyone can look inside. No top sheets on the bed - just a blanket! The room floor was never cleaned while we were there. Positives: very nice and helpful employees; cleanness; very charming; excellent location. I honestly liked the hotel. Really. If it just had the correct price...

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable and great place and great staff”
Reviews.Author: shreyasma
Reviews.Content: Hello folks, We had booked 2 rooms in the hotel through Gulliver's Travell Association.. It was a great experience in the hotel the staff are pretty nice to the guests and mainly the guy by name Daniel Neagoe was really helpful. We stayed at rooms 3 and 9 for 21 days from 17th august till 6th september 2008.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Great Way to Visit London”
Reviews.Author: johhnnyrocks
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in London several times before and through a friend had heard about these Castletown Lettings apartments www.castletownhouse.co.uk available in West Kensington and contacted them directly for booking. Found the total experience excellent in every regard. Pricing was well below a good hotel with many more amenities than the hotel had offered. The rooms were fully equipped (big screen flat panel television, wireless internet, full kitchen with oven microwave, large spacious bedrooms, and living room as well). Couldn't have asked for a better location. West Kensington I think is the "in" neighborhhod in London, it's clean elegant, safe and convenient. We were ~5 minutes from a tube stop, and five minites from some great dining spots. Really enjoyed going out to a Thai restaraunt one night for dinner and being able to store our leftovers in our own fridge, and the two minute stroll to a great cafe for morning coffee. Couldn't recommend them more highly. Clean, roomy, ideal location, and most importantly felt at home!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable base for seeing London”
Reviews.Author: CyndLooWho
Reviews.Content: We booked Kensington West through the Eurostar website, along with our train tickets from Brussels to London. We chose it for the price, and because we could get a quad room on short notice (we booked 3 days before we arrived). For a budget hotel, this is a good option. It's not necessarily near any places on the to-do list, but it is only a 5 minute walk to the West Kensington Tube station, with easy access to everywhere via Tube. The neighborhood seemed to be very working class, and the hotel was a few blocks from the nearest busy street. We did not feel uneasy about the location, but a woman on her own might not feel the same way. As with every hotel where we've stayed in London, there was conversation noise from outside until the early hours of the night. The hotel was clean and recently refurbished. The kids loved the fold-up bunk beds, which were ready made with clean linens. As with all London hotel rooms, this was small, but it was easier to move around in than our last quad room in London, and more smartly laid out. The minimalist wardrobe had no doors, so it was easy to stow our stuff without having to rearrange the room. The room is equipped with a good, flat screen tv for your BBC viewing pleasure, though it's really only visible from the double bed. On check-in, our room for 4 only contained 1 towel, but the front desk clerk took care of that reasonably quickly. They don't have keys to the linen closet after the cleaning staff leaves, so check that you have what you need as soon as you check in. The light fixtures were cracked from being screwed too tightly, and the bathroom shelf was missing, but the room was otherwise in good repair. I didn't see any air conditioning, but we don't visit London in the summer... There are free hot drinks in the lobby, but don't expect much from the add-on breakfast. It appeared to be yogurt and a granola bar. It was not really overpriced, just not quite what we wanted for breakfast. We simply purchased breakfast food from the grocery store and had that before heading out for the day. There weren't many places to eat nearby, but it was easy to find grub near the places we were visiting, so that did not bother us. Overall, we were happy with this hotel. For a place to sleep between forays into the city, it was very adequate, and we would consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place!! Not sure what the good reviews are...”
Reviews.Author: quake3addicts
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews from here and trip advisor. All had medium things to say. First this is not a hotel but a Bread and Breakfast. I attempted to check in at 1:30 and was told that checkin was at 2:30. There was noone in the hotel at all, they must have had rooms. Second, nothing worked at front desk, credit card mach., phone, internet, wireless etc. Third I was checked into a closet, seriously I have stayed in London many times before, this was a walk in closet; with a suitcase you had to step on the bed to get to bathroom. The door would not open fully from the bathroom as the bed is 6 inches away. I requested another room, after some serious grumbling I was sent to antoher room. Larger size, bathroom was ridiculous small. The toilet was in the shower, YES it is!!! The shower curtain had so much mold it was HARD!! YES!! The mattress is basically a box spring, all night metal springs poking you. I booked 3 nights and left after one. Expedia could not dial international to attempt to refund the difference. I have stopped payment. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: TavelingGirl05
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, the customer service was horrible and the hotel double charged our credit card and refused to give us back our money. I would not recommend to stay here. The beds were dirty, our room smelled like a toilet and there was no heat, along with a broken lift. Please think twice about staying at this hotel. It's not worth the money or aggrivation.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but at a great price”
Reviews.Author: FriesAndFoieGras
Reviews.Content: Any clean, bright room with newly painted walls, modern bathroom and a bed with clean linen for only 50Pounds (for a Queen bed) to be had in London wins high marks from me. 5-7min walk to West Kensington Tube took us through a quiet neighborhood that some may mistake for shady, but I would describe as just a little shabby, as one would expect of London, but no unsavory characters in sight. Multiple doors did not bother us as this is the standard in London due to fire safety regulations. But from previous reviews and my own experience, it seems like the lift is permanently out of order! This may be a problem if you are staying on the higher floors (my second floor room was accessible) and have to lug your suitcase up the narrow staircase. So guests may wish to request a room on the lower floors. The room is very very small! Once we opened our samsonite on the floor there was hardly space to walk around. We had to shimmy past each other sideways and if I sat on the edge of the bed, my knees almost touched the facing wall.... There was no wardrobe to speak of, only a metal bar in an open wooden compartment 1.5ft across, but with hangers for use. The bathroom was clean and modern with black and white tiles. But once again, the sink was tiny to properly brush my teeth over. No towels or toiletries were provided, which was a bit of a disappointment. However, the lovely high ceilings, easy-on-the-eye pastel green walls and sheets, new carpeting really made this a good deal for the night. No problem with the wifi connection and people at the front desk were helpful and printed out the e-tickets we needed for our onward journey. This is not a luxury hotel, but new, good and clean and that's all we needed to rest our heads at night.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience. Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: kshamus
Reviews.Content: Overall We stayed at this hotel for a week in September and overall had a great experience. The rooms were clean and it did seem as if they were newly refurbished which was nice. The rooms are rather small, but this is London and that's what you get. The room was mostly taken up by a bed and the dresser/desk, but the two of us were able to get around the room without any problems. There was a flat screen TV on a bracket that was convenient to catch the news or a movie on, but not in the way or taking up valuable space. The room served its purpose for us, which was mainly as a place to sleep between busy days sightseeing. I would reiterate the comment others have made about the stairs and doors. You do go through a few doors and probably one or two flights of staits on your way in and out so I would consider that if you think about staying here. At the end of the day, this was a pretty good hotel for the money and we would definitely think about staying here again. Staff The staff was very friendly and helped us on a few occasions. First we needed to check in early and this wasn't a problem at all. Secondly, we needed a wake up call one morning to catch a train and when we discovered our room had no phone outlet, the front desk clerk (who was as surprised as us about the phone) volunteered to come by our room and knock on the door at 6AM so we could catch our train. Location We felt the location was great! It was a five minute walk to the West Kensington tube station which allows you to take the District Line to almost all of the major tourist attractions. It's not hard to switch trains in London, but if you can avoid it, why wouldn't you? There weren't a ton of places to eat near the hotel, but there were enough to get by if you had to. There was a pub/bar, a Chinese restaurant, and a few cafes that were open for breakfast and lunch. We mostly ate closer to the City Center, but on the few nights we were near the hotel we ate in the area and it was great. Finally, we definitely felt safe in the area, even walking at night from the tube station to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: GalwaygirlSinead
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friends stayed here for a weekend on a girly weekend. We found the accommodation perfect for our needs. Booked in at around 10 at night. We had two family rooms. One room had a double bed and bunk beds and the other room had 3 single beds and 2 bunk beds. We had more beds than we needed. Our rooms and ensuites were very clean. The hotel doesn't have a bar or a restaurant. We got hungary the first night so we just phoned down and they ordered a pizza for us no problem. There isn't much in West Kensington. There is a lovely cafe down the road for breakfast and we just got the tube to everywhere else. The tube station is only a 5 min walk away. This is a great place for a group of friends to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Kensington West Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 25 Matheson Road, London W14 8SN, England (Formerly Aston Court Hotel)
